alert.note: Alert for Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 7:27PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Weston and south central Crook Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 727 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Upton to 11 miles south of Osage to 4 miles northeast of Morrisey. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Upton around 740 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Osage. This includes Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 161 and 165. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for northeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills
